alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 7:31AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland, southwestern Pottawatomie and southeastern McClain Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 731 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Thunderbird to 3 miles north of Noble. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Norman, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lexington, Goldsby, Wayne, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Etowah, Rosedale, southern Lake Thunderbird and Trousdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
